researchPillars.title: AI-Driven Drug Discovery
researchPillars.description: We build and apply deep learning models to screen vast chemical libraries, identifying novel therapeutic candidates for genetic diseases.

researchPillars.title: CRISPR Systems Biology
researchPillars.description: Developing next-generation CRISPR-Cas9 functional genomic screens to map complex gene regulatory networks at scale.

researchPillars.iconSvg: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="h-10 w-10" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" d="M11 3.055A9.001 9.001 0 1020.945 13H11V3.055z" /><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" d="M20.488 9H15V3.512A9.025 9.025 0 0120.488 9z" /></svg>
researchPillars.title: Single-Cell Transcriptomics
researchPillars.description: Pioneering new computational methods to analyze single-cell RNA-seq data, resolving cellular heterogeneity in development and disease.

publications.title: A scalable deep learning framework for predicting gene expression from DNA sequence
Mapping enhancer-promoter interactions in 3D using multiplexed CRISPR-FlowFISH
Dissecting tumor heterogeneity with spatial single-cell transcriptomics

principalInvestigator.name: Dr. Evelyn R. Kestrel
principalInvestigator.title: Principal Investigator
principalInvestigator.bio: Dr. Kestrel is a Professor in the Department of Genetics and Genomic Sciences. Her research focuses on developing computational tools to understand the non-coding genome. She is a recipient of the NIH Director's New Innovator Award.
